info.title: Shapes and Categories API
info.description: API documentation for managing categories and shapes.

get.summary: Get all categories with optional formatting and filtering

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Optional. Specifies the response format. By default, the response is formatted. Use 'nested' for a nested category structure.filters and sorting will not work if any format is selected

parameters.name: sortName
parameters.description: Optional. The field to sort by. Defaults to 'createdAt'.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Optional. The sort order, either 'asc' for ascending or 'desc' for descending. Defaults to 'asc'.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Dynamic filters for querying categories. Use dot notation to specify filters (e.g., `filters[name][$operator]=value`). The following fields are supported for filtering: **`name`**, **`parent`**, **`path`**. Allowed operators: `$eq`, `$ne`, `$in`, `$gte`, `$lte`, `$gt`, `$lt`.

200.description: List of formatted categories or nested categories

example.name: default parent
example.description: new category for accion labs child

allDescendants.name: default parent
allDescendants.description: new category for accion labs child

get.note: Filters will work when no format is selected. Filters can be applied to fields like 'name', 'parent', and 'path' using the following operators: '$eq', '$ne', '$in', '$gte', '$lte', '$gt', '$lt'. Example: categories?filters[name][$eq]=layer shape 3

example.name: default parent child v1
example.description: new category for accion labs child

get.description: Retrieve a specific category by its unique ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the category

delete.description: Deletes a category based on the provided ID. The ID must be a valid ObjectId. Additionally, you can pass `categoryIdForExistingShapes` as a query parameter to associate the deletion with shapes under that category.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the category to delete

parameters.name: categoryIdForExistingShapes
parameters.description: The ID of the category for existing shapes to be affected by the deletion

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Dynamic filters for querying shapes. Use dot notation to specify filters (e.g., `filters[field][$operator]=value`).The following fields are supported for filtering:

 **`name`**, **`type`**, **`author`**, **`tags`**, **`category`**, **`version`**

metadata.description: A detailed description of the shape
A detailed description of the shape
A detailed description of the shape

get.description: Retrieves a shape's details based on the provided ID. The ID must be a valid ObjectId.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the shape to retrieve

metadata.description: A detailed description of the shape

put.description: Updates the details of an existing shape using its ID. The ID must be a valid ObjectId.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the shape to update

metadata.description: An updated description of the shape
An updated description of the shape

message.example: Invalid ID format or request body

delete.description: Delete a specific shape by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the shape to delete

get.description:
This endpoint allows you to search for parent shapes based on dynamic filters. Use dot notation to specify filters (e.g., `filters[field][$operator]=value`). The following fields are supported for filtering:

 **`name`**, **`type`**, **`author`**, **`tags`**, **`category`**, **`version`**

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Dynamic filters for querying shapes. You can use dot notation to specify filters. The following fields are supported for filtering:

 **`name`**, **`type`**, **`author`**, **`tags`**, **`category`**, **`version`**

200.description: List of parent shapes matching the filters

total.description: Total number of shapes matching the filter

400.description: Invalid query parameters or filter format

404.description: No shapes found matching the filter

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: The ID of the category to retrieve shapes for.

200.description: List of shapes in the specified category

404.description: Category not found or incorrect category ID

parent.description: if parent id given then its a child, otherwise optional

path.description: The computed path of the category. (Read-only)

type.description: The type of the shape (required). Can be 2D, 3D, LAYERS, or COMPONENT.

attachTo.description: An optional field to attach the shape to another entity or category (optional).

svgFile.description: An optional SVG file name or path (optional)

svgContent.description: The content of the SVG (required for 2D and 3D shapes). It is a string representation of the SVG content.

version.description: The version of the shape (optional). This is useful to track different versions of the same shape.

category.description: A reference to the category to which the shape belongs (optional).

description.description: A detailed description of the shape (optional).

customProperties.description: Custom properties that allow for flexible, user-defined data (optional).

metadata.description: Metadata for the shape, including description, application types, custom properties, and dependencies (optional).

tags.description: A list of tags associated with the shape, useful for categorization or filtering (optional).

author.description: The author of the shape (required). This identifies who created the shape.

diagram_components.description: A list of components in the diagram associated with the shape. Each component can have various properties.

items.description: An arbitrary object representing a diagram component. The structure can vary for each component.

attachment_points.description: A list of attachment points for the shape. Each attachment point can have various properties.

items.description: An arbitrary object representing an attachment point. The structure can vary for each attachment point.
